column5: Try www.npfishcamp.com it is not a fly-in but the last 5 miles is by water and they pick you up, wonderful fishing and a fun place, food is good too, nice lodge, lots of fish stories, if you go to their web site tell them sharon sent you and they have a great special offer for you.ThanksSee ya on the waterSharon
Slate Fall Outfitters in Sioux Lookout will take two at that time of the summer.
Thanks for all the tips. We made reservations with Ogoki Frontier.Gray Wolf
Gray: My wife and I are flying ito Ceasars lodge the last week of august,we talked to these people at the sports show,if you would like more info E-mail me. Ed
I would like to take my wife to a fly-in outpost in late August. Does anyone know of a fly-in service that will take a party of two? All of the websites I've checked require a minimum party of four.

I've done several 2 man trips with vikingoutposts.com out of Red Lake. This year 2 of us are going out of Armstrong With ogokifrontier.com in Sept. There are many more that will take just you and your wife.
I know Ceasars Lodge has accomadated two in the past ( even tho they say 4 min), check it out.

Get information from Pickerel Arm Camps - www.pickerelarm.comThey may also have availabilities for two, especially during that time of the year. Actually, just about ALL outfitters have vacancies in late summer.

I know of many fly in outposts that can accomidate 2 people. What do you think of Saskatchewan, Canada? Great fishing and accomidations. Good prices. Let me know if I can be of any further assistance.Mark Thomas[email protected]

Thanks for the information. My wife and I are not meat hunters. We just enjoy catching fish and exploring. We would like to hear your experiences with these outfitters and recommendations on the lakes.
try leuenbergers out of nakina,my wife and i were there last year ,the hot showers were a real hit with her.
Try Knobby's in Souix Lookout, ONT. They can handle just about any request.
